questions.question_text: What is a specific instance of a completed or running workflow called?

discussion.content:
Correct B

https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Orchestrator/5.5.1/com.vmware.vsphere.vco_using_client.doc/GUID-9366A590-4DB6-485F-8557-5139EBE12851.html

A workflow token represents a workflow that is running or has run.

A workflow is an abstract description of a process that defines a generic sequence of steps and a generic set of required input parameters. When you run a workflow with a set of real input parameters, you receive an instance of this abstract workflow that behaves according to the specific input parameters you give it. This specific instance of a completed or a running workflow is called a workflow token.
Shouldn't this be B and C? The question is create, not request.

comments.content:
You create a machine from a blueprint by submitting a request, so definitely C & D.

Tenant Admin would be able to manage the catalog service containing that request, but wouldn't be the one to submit the request to actually get the machine created.

questions.question_text:
A user in the Dev business group is out of the office and a machine needs to be created from a blueprint in vRealize Automation for the team.
Which two roles can create the machine on behalf of the Dev team member? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: in VRA 8 this is Resource Limits

questions.question_text: What can be used in custom forms to prevent a user from entering too large a value (such as too much memory for a virtual machine)?

choices.D: Modify the network profile in the reservation.

discussion.content: According to the reference link, IaaS Administrator configures the Health Service, so he is not view only. It also states "Tenant administrators with a Health Consumer role can view test results for their tenancy but cannot configure or run a test." Based on that, I am guessing B and E.

comments.content: Tenant administrators with the Health Consumer role can see only the test card for their tenancy.

discussion.content:
B and D.

Tenant administrators with a Health Consumer role can view test results for their tenancy but cannot configure or run a test. If Tenanct Admin without Health Consumer role, TA can't view the test results ...


https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.6/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-9A0BA735-E657-4093-833B-A9517F9E188A.html

B&E
The question is which two roles should be assigned to the user to display the tenant filtered tests and the answer is health consumer and tenant administrator. With these two roles, the user can see health checks for a tenant that has permissions.

comments.content:
Answer is *NOT* D:
"IaaS administrators can see all test cards."

discussion.content:
Correct answer is: B & E

"Tenant administrators with the Health Consumer role can see only the test card for their tenancy."
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.5/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-EDED7D96-B7C7-4567-B3F5-71CB017650FE.html

D. IaaS Administrator & E. Tenant Administrator 

Log in to the vRealize Automation console as an IaaS administrator or as a tenant administrator. 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.6/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-EDED7D96-B7C7-4567-B3F5-71CB017650FE.html

comments.content:
My answer is wrong.
B & E are correct.

discussion.content: Tenant administrators with the Health Consumer role can see only the test card for their tenancy. https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.3/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-EDED7D96-B7C7-4567-B3F5-71CB017650FE.html

questions.question_text: Which two roles can view only Health Service test cards for a specific tenant? (Choose two.)
